results.title: All that jazz starring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen
results.brief_description: Documentary film featuring Kenny Ball and his Jazzmen performing live on stage interspersed with personal anecdotes by Kenny Ball about his life on the road as a jazz musician. The music is great, from dixieland to gospel, and includes the memorable “Midnight in Moscow” along with “When the Saints go marching in”, “We shall not be moved” and many other jazz favourites. No credits available.

results.title: All that jazz [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Bob Fosse, Robert A Aurthur and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Joe Gideon is a chain-smoking, pill popping workaholic obsessed with producing, directing and choreographing a Broadway musical while womanising and editing his latest film (actually Fosse’s own film “Lenny”). This semi-autobiographical musical drama is framed by Gideon’s conversations with a mysterious figure of nemesis the “Lady in White”. Following Gideon’s heart attack, the film assumes a surreal hallucinatory logic. Not only does Fosse borrow freely from the European classics “8 1/2” and “The Seventh seal” but he inverts the showbiz and life affirming “That’s entertainment” ethos of the traditional musical. Cast includes Roy Scheider, Jessica Lange, Ann Reinking and John Lithgow. Awards: Winner, Best Art Direction, Costume Design, Editing, Best Score, Academy Awards, 1979.

results.title: All that heaven allows [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Douglas Sirk, Ross Hunter and Universal International Pictures
results.brief_description: A respected middle-aged New England widow (Jane Wyman) with two grown children becomes the victim of smalltown gossip when she rejects socially acceptable alternatives for the love of her gardener, a much younger man (Rock Hudson). Sirk uncovers something of the paradox of middle America in the fifties - gleaming surfaces masking a crisis in values - by using the elements of the woman’s melodrama from within to expose the confining complacency and emotional aridity of small town middle-class life. Cast also includes Agnes Moorhood, Virginia Grey, Gloria Talbot and William Reynolds.

results.title: All quiet on the western front
results.brief_description: Regarded as a landmark in American cinema, and a film which pioneered depiction of the “irony” of war. The directional quality has been compared with Eisenstein for its biting commentary and emotional outcry against war. Its bravura direction fixed in millions of viewers minds the image of youth in the trenches. Lead star, Lew Ayres, became a true-to-life conscientious objector of war after portraying its moving scenes.

results.title: All the pretty horses
results.creator_credit: Billy Bob Thornton, Robert Salerno, Miramax Films and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: John Grady Cole (Matt Damon) and his friend Lacey Rawlins (Henry Thomas) are young Texan men dreaming of an exciting life as cowboys. They set out for Mexico in search of employment, adventure and a better life. On their travels they met Jimmy Blevins (Lucas Black), a drifter wanted for stealing a horse, and they allow him to join their travels. In Mexico, they begin working for Hector de la Rocha (Ruben Blades), a wealthy landowner, raising his young and idealistic daughter, Alejandra (Penelope Cruz) alone. When Alejandra professes her love for Cole, her aunt (Miriam Colon) fights desperately to break up their love affair. When the authorities discover the boys working on the property, their past catches up with them and they are arrested for the theft of the horse. Cole must fight to prove his innocence and win back Alejandra. A coming of age western directed by Billy Bob Thornton, based on the novel of the same time by Cormac McCarthy.

results.title: All my own bush
results.brief_description: A Secondary School student takes a movie camera to the bushland around Monbulk and is suddenly aware of man’s intrusion into the bush. Suitable for mid-upper Primary School.

results.title: All men are liars
results.creator_credit: Gerard Lee, John Maynard and Arena Films
results.brief_description: In an attempt to reunite his family, which has fallen apart over a hocked piano, sensitive 17 year old Mick O’Brien joins the all girl “Total Fire Band” to earn some extra cash. He falls in love with the lead singer Angela whos been jilted by one too many lying men. She’s hot for Mick too, but not because hes cute and talented, but being a woman he’s sure to be honest! Great performances from Toni Pearen and especially John Jarrat as the has-been Elvis impersonator adds to the hilarity of this left-of-centre comedy.

results.title: All the presidents men
results.creator_credit: Alan Pakula, Walter Coblenz, Warner Bros Pictures and Wildwood Enterprises
results.brief_description: This is an understated thriller which remains close to Woodward and Bernstein’s account of the uncovering of the Watergate trail of corruption right to the President’s door. Together with Klute (1971) and The Parallax View (1974) it forms what has been called Pakula’s ‘paranoia trilogy’: film noir for the seventies. This film updates the investigative drama in pseudo-documentary style which had been a significant phase of film noir in the forties. The labyrinth in 1973 is the communication network which has to be commanded and manipulated for the investigator-reporters to uncover the enigmas facing them, the voice of Deep Throat in the darkness of subterranean carparks notwithstanding. Cast includes Dustin Hoffman, Robert Redford, Jack Warden, Martin Balsam and Jason Robards. Based on the book by Carl Bernstein and Bob Woodward.

results.title: All Is full of love
results.brief_description: Chris Cunningham’s elegant film clip for Bjork’s All is full of love depicts the construction and subsequent desire between two intertwined robots. Designed by Cunningham himself, the two machines, whose faces bear more than a passing resemblance to Bjork sensually move in and around each other as a milky white fluid flows over their sexualised bodies.

results.title: All in together
results.creator_credit: Mike Boland, Tarni James, Film Victoria and Canaus Films
results.brief_description: A warm and inspiring documentary which explores the attitudes and relationships between disabled and abled children through the liberating experience of a week long campout. Both mentally and physically disabled children discover a sense of self and achievement. Parents of disabled children also present their views.
